context.p: To install Eucalyptus on Debian Sid (Unstable), perform the following tasks.

info.codeblock: apt-get install eucalyptus-cloud eucalyptus-cc eucalyptus-walrus eucalyptus-sc eucalyptus-nc

step.cmd: Configure the eucalyptus.conf file. Because this is a single node installation on a network with DHCP, we will use System mode for networking, which is the default. The only option you should need to change is:
Create your network bridge. For more information, go to https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NetworkConnectionBridge.

info.codeblock: euca_conf --get-credentials admin.zip unzip admin.zip source eucarc

step.cmd: Start the cloud components and register services:

info.codeblock: euca_conf --register-walrus -H <hostname> -C walrus -P walrus euca_conf --register-sc -H <hostname> -C SC_<NAME> -P PARTI00 euca_conf --register-cluster -H <hostname> -C CC_<NAME> -P PARTI00 service eucalyptus-cc start euca_conf --register-nodes <hostname> service eucalyptus-nc start

step.stepresult: At this point, you have a running cloud.

step.cmd: ensure that the Node Controller (NC) is advertising resources:
step.stepresult: Eucalyptus returns output similar to the following: AVAILABILITYZONE PARTI00 192.168.51.251 arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_251/ AVAILABILITYZONE |- vm types free / max cpu ram disk AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.small 0004 / 0004 1 128 2 AVAILABILITYZONE |- c1.medium 0002 / 0002 1 256 5 AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.large 0001 / 0001 2 512 10 AVAILABILITYZONE |- m1.xlarge 0000 / 0000 2 1024 20 AVAILABILITYZONE |- c1.xlarge 0000 / 0000 4 2048 20

taskbody.result: Congratulations! You should now have a fully configured cloud. Check out the User Guide to learn about bundling and uploading images to your cloud.
